sen.j: 法雲寺（ほううんじ）は、奈良県生駒郡平群町に所在する日蓮正宗の寺院。
sen.e: Houn-ji Temple is a Nichiren Sho sect temple located in Heguri-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Houn-ji Temple is a Nichiren Sho sect temple located in Heguri-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Houn-ji Temple is a Nichiren Sho sect temple located in Heguri-cho, Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は竜田山（たつたさん）。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Tatsutasan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Tatsutasan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Tatsutasan.

sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）9月13日 - 建立される。
開基は日蓮正宗大石寺第66世法主日達上人。
sen.e: Kaiki (a patron of a temple in its founding) is Nichidatsu Shonin, the 66th head priest of Nichiren Sho sect Taiseki-ji Temple.
The kaiki (a patron of a temple in its founding) was Nichidatsu Shonin, the 66th head priest of Nichiren Sho sect Taiseki-ji Temple.
The kaiki (a patron of a temple in its founding) was Nichidatsu Shonin, the 66th head priest of Nichiren Sho sect Taiseki-ji Temple.

sen.j: 奈良県生駒郡平群町竜田川２丁目１−１

sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字にしました。

sen.j: 平群町立平群南小学校
近鉄生駒線竜田川駅から徒歩10分
sen.e: A 10-minute walk from Tatsutagawa Station on the Kintetsu Ikoma Line.
